Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 11th overall pick, by Diablo in 1975...
Traded from Diablo to Boston (FBA) on 1/31/1975 (Going to SHP: 3B T. Hodapp. Going to DIA: P G. Sibley, 1B L. Pellegrino, 2B A. Diaz)...
Had first career hit (double) on 7/21/1976, off Andres Echeverria (NE)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/17/1977, off Ray Barnett (WIS)...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1977...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Third Base in 1977...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Third Base in 1979...
Had 5 hits with 7 RBI against Plum Grove on 7/30/1980...
Injured on 10/13/1980 with a Strained Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 7 weeks...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1980...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Third Base in 1980...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/14/1982, hitting .536 with 2 HR, 13 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Plum Grove on 8/31/1983...
Drove in 7 runs against Manchester on 5/18/1984...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/18/1984, hitting .556 with 1 HR, 4 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 9/1/1984, hitting .470 with 3 HR, 19 RBI...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1985...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/1986, hitting .409 with 3 HR, 18 RBI...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1986...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1987...
Drove in 7 runs against Troy on 8/31/1988...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1988...
Signed as a free agent by Pittsburgh on 2/1/1989 to a 4-year deal worth $7,380,000 per year...
Had 2000th career hit on 5/25/1989, off Joseph Clyde (CI)...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Wisconsin on 7/17/1989...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1989, hitting .500 with 0 HR, 6 RBI...
Was selected to the 1991 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Northeastern on 9/17/1991...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1991...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Boston (UBA) on 5/17/1992...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1992, hitting .545 with 1 HR, 7 RBI...
